_description: Configuration file for testing img2img parameters. Edit values here instead of in the code.

model._description: Checkpoint/model file name. 'type' can be 'checkpoint' (in models/checkpoints/) or 'diffusion' (in models/diffusion_models/). Note: Diffusion models like z_image_turbo may need a different workflow file. Use list_models.py to select models.

denoise._description: How much to modify the image (0.0-1.0). Lower = more preservation, Higher = more change. 0.3-0.4 preserves person well, 0.5+ may distort features.

cfg._description: CFG scale - how closely to follow the prompt (typically 1.0-20.0). Higher = stronger prompt adherence. 7-10 is a good range.

steps._description: Number of sampling steps. More steps = better quality but slower. 20-30 is usually good.

seed._description: Random seed for reproducibility. Set to null/empty for random seed each run, or set a number for consistent results.

sampler_name._description: Sampler algorithm - controls how noise is removed during generation. See _available_samplers below for full list and descriptions.

_available_samplers.euler: Fast, basic quality. Good for quick tests. Fastest option.
_available_samplers.euler_cfg_pp: Euler with CFG++ (better prompt adherence). Faster than standard euler with better quality.
_available_samplers.euler_ancestral: Euler with ancestral sampling (more variation). Good balance of speed and quality.
_available_samplers.euler_ancestral_cfg_pp: Euler ancestral with CFG++. Better prompt adherence than standard ancestral.
_available_samplers.heun: Balanced quality and speed. Good default choice.
_available_samplers.heunpp2: Heun++ variant. Improved version of heun.
_available_samplers.exp_heun_2_x0_sde: Experimental Heun with SDE (Stochastic Differential Equation). Advanced option.
_available_samplers.dpm_2: DPM-2 sampler. Older algorithm, decent quality.
_available_samplers.dpm_2_ancestral: DPM-2 with ancestral sampling. More variation than dpm_2.
_available_samplers.dpm_fast: Fast DPM variant. Very fast but lower quality.
_available_samplers.dpm_adaptive: Adaptive DPM. Automatically adjusts steps for quality.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2s_ancestral: DPM++ 2S Ancestral. Good quality, ancestral variation.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2s_ancestral_cfg_pp: DPM++ 2S Ancestral with CFG++. Better prompt adherence.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_sde_gpu: DPM++ SDE GPU-optimized. High quality, GPU accelerated.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2m: DPM++ 2M. Excellent quality, good speed. Recommended for preserving details. Currently selected.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2m_cfg_pp: DPM++ 2M with CFG++. Excellent quality with better prompt adherence.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2m_sde: DPM++ 2M SDE. Very high quality, slower. Best for preserving identity.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2m_sde_gpu: DPM++ 2M SDE GPU-optimized. Very high quality, GPU accelerated.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2m_sde_heun: DPM++ 2M SDE with Heun. Very high quality variant.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_2m_sde_heun_gpu: DPM++ 2M SDE Heun GPU-optimized. Very high quality, GPU accelerated.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_3m_sde: DPM++ 3M SDE. Highest quality, slowest. Best for final results.
_available_samplers.dpmpp_3m_sde_gpu: DPM++ 3M SDE GPU-optimized. Highest quality, GPU accelerated.
_available_samplers.ddpm: DDPM (Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Model). Original diffusion algorithm.
_available_samplers.lcm: LCM (Latent Consistency Model). Very fast, good for quick iterations.
_available_samplers.res_multistep_cfg_pp: Residual multistep with CFG++. Advanced option with better prompt adherence.
_available_samplers.res_multistep_ancestral: Residual multistep ancestral. Advanced option with variation.
_available_samplers.res_multistep_ancestral_cfg_pp: Residual multistep ancestral with CFG++. Advanced option.
_available_samplers.gradient_estimation_cfg_pp: Gradient estimation with CFG++. Advanced option.
_available_samplers.sa_solver_pece: SA Solver PECE variant. Advanced option.
_available_samplers.ddim: DDIM (Denoising Diffusion Implicit Model). Deterministic, reproducible results.
_available_samplers.uni_pc_bh2: UniPC BH2 variant. Fast and efficient variant.

scheduler._description: Noise schedule - controls how noise is gradually removed. See _available_schedulers below for full list and descriptions.

_available_schedulers.simple: Simple linear schedule. Basic, predictable noise reduction.
_available_schedulers.sgm_uniform: SGM (Score-based Generative Model) uniform schedule. Good for general use.
_available_schedulers.karras: Karras schedule. Popular choice, good balance. Currently selected. Works well with most samplers.
_available_schedulers.exponential: Exponential schedule. Faster noise reduction at start, slower at end.
_available_schedulers.ddim_uniform: DDIM uniform schedule. Deterministic, good for reproducibility.
_available_schedulers.beta: Beta schedule. Uses beta values for noise reduction.
_available_schedulers.normal: Normal/Gaussian schedule. Standard noise reduction curve.
_available_schedulers.kl_optimal: KL-optimal schedule. Mathematically optimal for certain models.

prompt_overrides._description: If true, override prompts from workflow file. Prompts are read from the files below.

debug_logging._description: Enable detailed logging of parameters and LLM outputs for debugging. Logs are saved to the specified file.

ollama._description: Ollama API settings. text_model: model for evaluation and prompt suggestions (lighter/faster options: mistral:7b-instruct-q4_0, qwen2.5:7b-instruct, mistral:7b-instruct). vision_model: model for image analysis (llava:7b, llava-phi3:latest, bakllava:7b). timeout: seconds to wait for response. retry_attempts: number of retries on failure. retry_delay: seconds to wait between retries.
